The Lonely Veil.text: Your name is Aragon and you are a top general of a rebel group called Shrouded. You guys finally get enough resources and courage to rebel against the big corporations that run the world and have used up the world’s resources for their own greed. Your rebellion fails, but you somehow manage to survive. Your friends, colleagues, and leaders are all gone. You have nothing left and you are being hunted by human and AI soldiers trained to hunt down fugitives. You also have a bounty out for you, so even local bounty hunters are pursuing you. You are smart and resourceful and have deep connections to a flourishing black market. You have heard of a better life somewhere far away and this is your only chance. You disguise yourself and go into the city’s slums. You find 3 people that have information about how you can get out of earth. [[Who will you trust?]]

You encounter an asteroid.text:
You're cruising fast through the outer rim of the asteroid belt with Vex in the pilot seat, her boots kicked up, chewing some synthetic gum like she’s on a joyride.

Vex smirks:
"You really trust me flying this close to the rocks? Brave, or stupid?"

Suddenly, a massive warning klaxon blares across the console.

NODE-9 (through comms):
"Impact imminent. One object detected. Velocity—high. Recommendation: evasive maneuver."

Ahead, a mid-sized asteroid spins toward you. You’ve got two seconds.

You're in the shadows of Dock 7, the wind from distant thrusters roaring around you. Zel checks the forged access codes again. One ship waits on the pad: a corporate cargo hauler. You hear footsteps—not security, but someone else.

A figure in a long coat steps from the smoke. His voice cuts through the static:
"You don't have to do this the hard way. There's another way off this rock, cleaner. Safer. Trust me."

Zel stiffens.
"That’s a Broker runner. I told you not to deal with them."

Wait. What kind of deal are we talking about?”

Outcome: The Broker runner smiles.
“A direct gate to freedom. No need for smuggler ships or corporate signatures. Just step inside.”

You follow him into a hangar with a sleek, unfamiliar ship. The ramp closes behind you.

A sharp hiss.

The floor beneath you turns transparent… revealing you’re not in a ship. You’re in a containment pod.

He speaks over comms:
“Congratulations. You’ve been delivered. Payment received.”

Engage with the guard ship using protoco.text:
NODE-9, spoof our ID. Make us look like a corporate salvage team.”

Outcome: NODE-9 engages its corrupted protocols, repurposing fragments of old access codes and voice logs.

The comms crackle.
Guard Ship: “...copy that. Resume course. Next time, respond faster.”

You navigate through the asteroid belt successfully and reach the 3 wormholes.

[[Final Approach]]

Go into stealth mode.text:
“Cut the engines. Power down everything. Let them pass.”

Outcome: The ship goes dark. The engines whine to a halt. NODE-9 hums nervously.

For a moment, there's silence.

Then:
Guard Ship: “Unregistered vessel detected. No beacon. Locking tractor beam.”

Lights flood the cabin. You feel the hull shudder.

NODE-9 says one final thing:
“Hiding was a statistically poor strategy. Goodbye.”

GAME OVER.

“Sometimes silence is the loudest answer.”

Dodge It.text:
“Veer right! Hard and fast!”

Outcome: The ship jolts violently as Vex yanks the controls. You narrowly dodge the asteroid—
But NODE-9 screams through static:
“Secondary mass detected—hidden in asteroid shadow. Collision imminent.”

You see it—a massive, dark behemoth of a rock, concealed behind the first one. Too close. Too fast.

Your ship is obliterated.

Vex’s last words:
“Well... guess I zigged when I should’ve zagged.”

GAME OVER.

“Even skilled pilots can’t outrun bad luck.”

Vex curses, kicks the console back into life.
“You’re a maniac. I love it. Let’s keep flying.”

Final Approach.text: [[The Blue Swirl]][[The Crimson Spiral]][[The Purple Void]]

The Blue Swirl.text:
Description: Calm, steady rotations. Almost hypnotic. Emits a faint hum that resonates in your chest.
Outcome:
 You emerge on a peaceful Earth-like world—lush, untouched. There's no sign of civilization, but the air is breathable, the water clean.


You survive

The Crimson Spiral.text:
Description: Twisting violently, edges sparking like it's tearing itself apart. The console glitches when scanned.
Outcome:
 You arrive in a war-torn industrial planet, ruled by megacorps even more ruthless than Earth. But… there's a resistance.


You can rise in power, or fall in the chaos.

The Purple Void.text:
Description: Nearly silent. Emits strange patterns of light that don’t follow any rhythm. Time feels… stretched.
Outcome:
 You exit into a reality where time, memory, and identity are fluid. You're not sure if you're still you. Echoes of the past replay. You may be in a simulation, or a dream… or another layer of existence entirely.
